intro: Stillingia phyllanthiformis, commonly known as the leafy stillingia, is a species of flowering plant native to eastern Asia. It belongs to the family Papaveraceae, which includes罂粟 (poppy) plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are often mistaken for those of the genus Phyllanthus. Its flowers are small and typically yellow or greenish, arranged in clusters. Stillingia phyllanthiformis is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks.
